intro: Freirea alsinefolia, commonly known as the silverleaf freirea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, silver-gray leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Freirea alsinefolia is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental appeal.
